Package com.esplibrary.client

Interface IESPClient

All Known Implementing Classes:
ESPValentineClient
public interface IESPClient
Interface for interacting with a V1.

  • Method Details

    • suggestedConnectionType

      static ConnectionType suggestedConnectionType(android.content.Context context)
      Returns the recommended ConnectionType based on device capabilities. For devices that support BLE, ConnectionType.LE is returned.
      Returns:
      Suggested ConnectionType

    • getClient

      static IESPClient getClient(android.content.Context appContext, @Nullable ESPClientListener listener, ConnectionType type, int dataTimeout)
      Deprecated.
      Use getClient(Context, ESPClientListener, ConnectionType, long)
      Returns a client initialized for the specified ConnectionType.
      Parameters:
      type - Connection typed this client will be using to communicate with a V1connectionWrapper.
      dataTimeout - Number of seconds the library will wait before indicating no ESP data has been received.
      listener - A listener to be invoked when ESP data has been received.
      Returns:
      Initialized client.

    • getClient

      static IESPClient getClient(android.content.Context appContext, @Nullable ESPClientListener listener, ConnectionType type, long dataTimeout)
      Returns a client initialized for the specified ConnectionType and no data timeout.
      Parameters:
      type - Connection typed this client will be using to communicate with a V1connectionWrapper.
      dataTimeout - Number of seconds the library will wait before indicating no ESP data has been received.
      listener - A listener to be invoked when ESP data has been received.
      Returns:
      Initialized client.

    • getDataTimeout

      int getDataTimeout()
      Deprecated.
      Use getDataTimeoutMillis()
      Returns the ESP data timeout in seconds
      Returns:
      ESP data timeout

    • setDataTimeout

      void setDataTimeout(int timeoutInSeconds)
      Deprecated.
      Use setDataTimeout(long)
      Set's the ESP data timeout
      Parameters:
      timeoutInSeconds - Timeout in seconds

    • getDataTimeoutMillis

      long getDataTimeoutMillis()
      Returns the ESP data timeout in milliseconds
      Returns:
      ESP data timeout

    • setDataTimeout

      void setDataTimeout(long timeoutMillis)
      Set's the ESP data timeout
      Parameters:
      timeoutMillis - Timeout in milliseconds

    • setDemoData

      void setDemoData(String demoData)
      Set's the dummy ESP data to be used while operating in Demo mode.
      Parameters:
      demoData - String ESP data

    • repeatDemoData

      void repeatDemoData(boolean repeat)
      Controls whether demo data should be repeated from start once the end is reached.
      Parameters:
      repeat - True if the data should be repeated.

    • protectLegacyMode

      void protectLegacyMode(boolean protect)
      Controls if ESP data should be sent while operating in Legacy mode.
      Parameters:
      protect - True if ESP data shouldn't be sent while in legacy mode.

    • setESPClientListener

      void setESPClientListener(ESPClientListener listener)
      Register a listener to be invoked when ESP data has been received.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener that will be invoked.

    • clearESPClientListener

      void clearESPClientListener()
      Removes the registered listener.

    • addConnectionListener

      void addConnectionListener(ConnectionListener listener)
      Add a listener to be invoked when a connection events occurs.

      Note: This callback will be invoked on main (UI) thread.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener that will be invoked.

    • removeConnectionListener

      void removeConnectionListener(ConnectionListener listener)
      Remove a listener for connection events. The listener will receive no further notifications of connection events.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.

    • setMalformedListener

      void setMalformedListener(MalformedDataListener listener)
      Register a listener to be invoked when bad ESP data has been received.

      Note: This callback will be invoked OFF of the main(UI) thread.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener that will be invoked.

    • clearMalformedListener

      void clearMalformedListener()
      Clears the registered listener. The listener will receive no further notifications of bad ESP data.

    • setNoDataListener

      void setNoDataListener(NoDataListener listener)
      Register a listener to be invoked when ESP data hasn't been detected.

      Note: This callback will be invoked on main (UI) thread.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener that will be invoked.
      See Also:
      • getDataTimeoutMillis()

    • clearNoDataListener

      void clearNoDataListener()
      Clears the registered listener. The listener will receive no further notifications of no ESP data detection.

    • setNotificationListener

      void setNotificationListener(NotificationListener listener)
      Register a listener to be invoked when Notification data has been received.

      Note: This callback will be invoked on main (UI) thread.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener that will be invoked.

    • clearNotificationListener

      void clearNotificationListener()
      Clears the registered listener. The listener will receive no further notification data.

    • connectDemo

      boolean connectDemo(String demoESPData, @Nullable ConnectionListener listener)
      Starts a demo connection.
      Parameters:
      demoESPData - stringified ESP data
      listener - An optional listener to register for connection events.
      Returns:
      True if a connection was attempted.

    • connect

      boolean connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device, ConnectionType connType, @Nullable ConnectionListener listener)
      Attempts to make a connection with device.

      If Bluetooth isn't supported, or an invalid connection type, of attempting to connect with a LE device without device support, this method immediately returns false and no connection is attempted.

      Parameters:
      device - Device to connect
      connType - Bluetooth type of device
      listener - Listener that will be invoked when connection events occur.
      Returns:
      True if a connection is attempted.

    • disconnect

      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the currently connected V1.

    • disconnect

      void disconnect(boolean notifyOnDisconnect)
      Disconnects from the currently connected V1.
      Parameters:
      notifyOnDisconnect - True if the registered ConnectionListener should be invoked when disconnected.

    • isConnected

      boolean isConnected()
      Indicates if there is a connection.
      Returns:
      True if connected.

    • isDemoMode

      boolean isDemoMode()
      Indicates if the library is operating in demo mode.
      Returns:
      True if operating in demo mode.

    • isConnecting

      boolean isConnecting()
      Indicate if a connection is being established.
      Returns:
      True if connection is established. If connected, this value returns false.

    • getConnectionType

      ConnectionType getConnectionType()
      Returns current type of the client.
      Returns:
      Connection type

    • getConnectedDevice

      android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getConnectedDevice()
      Returns the currently connected device. If disconnected, but a connection was established previously this returns the last connected device.
      Returns:
      Connected device.

    • getConnectedDeviceRSSI

      int getConnectedDeviceRSSI()
      Returns the last cached RSSI value for the currently connected BLE device.
      Returns:
      RSSI of the currently connected device.

    • readConnectedDeviceRSSI

      boolean readConnectedDeviceRSSI(@NonNull RSSICallback callback)
      Asynchronously reads the connected remote BLE devices RSSI and invokes callback once the value has been read.
      Parameters:
      callback - the callback that will be invoked with the read back RSSI value.

      Note: Regardless of the calling thread callback will always be invoked on main (UI) thread.
      Returns:
      True if an Asynchronously read has taken place. If false is returned, check the error log (Logcat Lvl. "Error") output for a hint as to why the call failed.

    • areDefaultSweepDefinitionsAvailableForV1Version

      boolean areDefaultSweepDefinitionsAvailableForV1Version(double v1Version)
      Indicate if the V1 supports Default Sweep definitions.
      Returns:
      True if the V1 supports reading Default
      See Also:
      • ESP Specification

    • getValentineType

      DeviceId getValentineType()
      Returns the type of the attached V1. If disconnected, or no V1 attached this value will be DeviceId.UNKNOWN_DEVICE.
      Returns:
      The type of the attached V1.

    • requestVersion

      void requestVersion(DeviceId device, ESPRequestedDataListener<String> callback)
      Request the firmware version of the provided device.
      Parameters:
      device - The {DeviceId device} to packet the version from
      callback - A callback that will be invoked when the version is received or if an error occurs.
      See Also:
      • ResponseVersion.getVersionDouble(String)

    • requestVersionAsDouble

      void requestVersionAsDouble(DeviceId device, ESPRequestedDataListener<Double> callback)
      Request the firmware version of the provided device as Double.
      Parameters:
      device - The {DeviceId device} to packet the version from
      callback - A callback that will be invoked when the version is received or if an error occurs.

    • requestSerialNumber

      void requestSerialNumber(DeviceId device, ESPRequestedDataListener<String> callback)
      Request the serial number of the provided device.
      Parameters:
      device - The device to packet the serial number from
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the serial number is received or if an error occurs.

    • requestUserSettings

      void requestUserSettings(double v1Version, ESPRequestedDataListener<UserSettings> callback)
      Request the current user modifiable settings in the V1.
      Parameters:
      v1Version - V1 version used to interpret the user settings. Versions greater than V4.0000 will result in a V19UserSettings to be passed to callback.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the settings are received or if an error occurs.

    • requestUserBytes

      void requestUserBytes(ESPRequestedDataListener<byte[]> callback)
      Request the current user modifiable settings in the V1.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the settings are received or if an error occurs.

    • requestWriteUserBytes

      void requestWriteUserBytes(byte[] userBytes, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to update the user configuration @link UserSettings settings} inside the V1.

      Note: This operation makes no guarantee that the V1's settings have been successfully updated with the provided user bytes, simply that the packet was sent and no errors were received.
      Parameters:
      userBytes - The new settings to update the V1's settings.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the userBytes are sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestFactoryDefault

      void requestFactoryDefault(DeviceId device, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to reset the provided device's factory settings.

      The effect of this packet will vary according to the target device's. Refer to the table 6.1 for the packet's effect on each device that complies with this specification.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the packet is sent or if an error occurs.
      See Also:
      • ESP Specification

    • requestWriteSweepDefinitions

      void requestWriteSweepDefinitions(List<SweepDefinition> sweeps, ESPRequestedDataListener<Integer> callback)
      Request for the V1 to use the List of custom sweeps instead of the factory sweeps when in Euro Mode.

      The number of supported sweeps is V1 version specific and can be obtained using requestMaxSweepIndex(ESPRequestedDataListener). The valid sweep sections can be read using requestSweepSections(ESPRequestedDataListener). If a sweep defintion is invalid, such as when a sweep definition crosses a sweep range boundary, the sweep will not be used. Refer to the Custom Sweep range for more details.

      Parameters:
      sweeps - List of custom sweeps the V1 should use.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when all sweeps have been written or if an error occurs.
        Callback accepts an integer as it's first param. This integer value is the sweep write result.
      • 0 == Sweep Write Successful.
      • Any Other Value equals the number of the first sweep with invalid parameters. (The error number returned will be the sweep index + 1, where sweep index is the index from the requestWriteSweepDefinitions(List, ESPRequestedDataListener)).

    • requestAllSweepDefinitions

      void requestAllSweepDefinitions(ESPRequestedDataListener<List<SweepDefinition>> callback)
      Request all custom custom sweep definitions.
      Parameters:
      callback - The ESPRequestedDataListener that will be invoked when all sweeps are received or an error occurs.

    • requestDefaultSweeps

      void requestDefaultSweeps(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request that the V1 reset all custom sweep definitions back to their default. When operating in Euro Mode, this will change the display from 'C' to 'U' or 'c' to 'u' depending on the user's mode selection.

      Note: This operation makes no guarantee that the V1's sweeps have been reset simply that the packet was sent and no errors were received. (see requestAllSweepDefinitions(ESPRequestedDataListener))
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the default sweeps packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestMaxSweepIndex

      void requestMaxSweepIndex(ESPRequestedDataListener<Integer> callback)
      Request to determine how many sweeps the current V1 version supports.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback will be invoked when the max sweep value is received or if an error occurs.

    • requestSweepSections

      void requestSweepSections(ESPRequestedDataListener<List<SweepSection>> callback)
      Request the V1's available custom sweep sections.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback will be invoked when the sweep sections are received or if an error occurs.

    • requestDefaultSweepDefinitions

      void requestDefaultSweepDefinitions(ESPRequestedDataListener<List<SweepDefinition>> callback)
      Request all default custom sweep definitions.
      Parameters:
      callback - The ESPRequestedDataListener that will be invoked when all sweeps are received or an error occurs.

    • requestSweepData

      void requestSweepData(double v1Version, ESPRequestedDataListener<SweepData> callback)
      Request all sweep data (max sweep index, sweep sections custom sweep definitions, default sweep definitions) from the V1.
      Parameters:
      v1Version - Version of the currently attached V1.
      callback - The callback will be invoked when the sweep data has been received or if an error occurs.

    • isLegacy

      boolean isLegacy()
      Indicates if the ESP client is currently operating in Legacy mode.
      Returns:
      True if the client is operating in demo mode.

    • requestDisplayOn

      void requestDisplayOn(boolean on, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Deprecated.
      Use requestSetDisplayState(boolean, boolean, ESPRequestListener)
      Request to force the V1's display on or off.
      Parameters:
      on - The new display state.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the display packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestAbortAudioDelay

      void requestAbortAudioDelay(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to abort the V1's current audio delay.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the display packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestSetDisplayState

      void requestSetDisplayState(boolean displayOn, boolean keepBTLedOn, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to force the V1's display off and optionally keep the Bluetooth LED on.
      Parameters:
      displayOn - The new display state.
      keepBTLedOn - Flag to determine if the Bluetooth LED should be kept on or off when the display is turned off. Ignored if displayOn is true.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the display packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestMute

      void requestMute(boolean mute, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to mute all alerts in the V1. The results of this packet can be verified using the InfDisplayData.getAuxData(). The V1 treats this packet as a mute button press. Therefore, this command is only in effect until all alerts are no longer being tracked byvthe V1.

      Note: The requestMute(false) will not unmute a laser alert
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the V1's has been muted/unmuted or if an error occurs.

    • requestChangeMode

      void requestChangeMode(V1Mode mode, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to change the current mode on the V1.
      Parameters:
      mode - The new mode the V1 should operate in
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the V1's mode has changed or if an error occurs.

    • requestCurrentVolume

      void requestCurrentVolume(ESPRequestedDataListener<byte[]> callback)
      Request to read the Valentine One's current volume settings.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the current volume settings are received or if an error occurs.

    • requestWriteVolumeSettings

      void requestWriteVolumeSettings(byte mainVolume, byte mutedVolume, byte aux0, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to change the Valentine One's current volume settings.
      Parameters:
      mainVolume - main volume (valid values are 0-9)
      mutedVolume - muted volume (valid values are 0-9)
      aux0 - reserved for future use by Valentine Research Inc.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the write Volume packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestStartAlertData

      void requestStartAlertData(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to receive information on all alerts being displayed on the V1's front panel.

      Alert information is represented by AlertData. Registering a ESPClientListener allows you to receive individual alerts by implementing ESPClientListener.onPacketReceived(ESPPacket). To receive a full alert table, implement ESPClientListener.onAlertTableReceived(List).

      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when alert information has started to be received or if an error occurs.

    • requestStopAlertData

      void requestStopAlertData(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to stop the V1 from sending alert information.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when stop alert data packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestStopAlertDataImmediately

      void requestStopAlertDataImmediately(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Requests the V1 to stop sending alert information as fast as possible.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when stop alert data packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestBatteryVoltage

      void requestBatteryVoltage(ESPRequestedDataListener<String> callback)
      Request the battery voltage at the connection to the V1.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the battery voltage is received or if an error occurs.

    • requestSAVVYStatus

      void requestSAVVYStatus(ESPRequestedDataListener<SAVVYStatus> callback)
      Request the current status from the SAVVY.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the SAVVYStatus is received or if an error occurs.

    • requestSAVVYStatus

      void requestSAVVYStatus(ESPRequestedDataListener<SAVVYStatus> callback, long requestTimeout)
      Request the current status from the SAVVY.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the SAVVYStatus is received or if an error occurs.
      requestTimeout - Number of milliseconds this request will wait for a response before timing out

    • requestVehicleSpeed

      void requestVehicleSpeed(ESPRequestedDataListener<Integer> callback)
      Request the current vehicle speed measured by the SAVVY.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the vehicle speed is received or if an error occurs.

    • requestOverrideThumbwheel

      void requestOverrideThumbwheel(byte speed, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to override the SAVVY mute threshold speed. The new speed setting will be used until the SAVVY is unplugged from the device or the thumbwheel is changed.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the override thumbwheel packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestOverrideThumbwheelToNone

      void requestOverrideThumbwheelToNone(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to disable SAVVY muting at any speed.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the override thumbwheel packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestOverrideThumbwheelToAuto

      void requestOverrideThumbwheelToAuto(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to mute at all speeds ("Auto").
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the override thumbwheel packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestSAVVYUnmute

      void requestSAVVYUnmute(boolean muteEnabled, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Request to enable or disable the unmute functionality in the SAVVY.
      Parameters:
      muteEnabled - Controls if unmuting is enabled
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the SAVVY unmute packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • destroy

      void destroy()
      Destroys the ESP client and clears all registered callbacks.
